org.newdawn.slick.opengl
Class InternalTextureLoader

java.lang.Object
  org.newdawn.slick.opengl.InternalTextureLoader

public class InternalTextureLoader
extends Object

A texture loaded based on many old versions that will load image data from a file and produce OpenGL textures.

Author:
kevin
See Also:
ImageData

Method Detail

isPowerOfTwo

public static boolean isPowerOfTwo(int n)

isForcePOT

public static boolean isForcePOT()
Returns true if we are forcing loaded image data into power-of-two OpenGL textures (by default, this is true). If non-power-of-two textures is not supported in hardware (i.e. isNPOTSupported returns false), then the image data will be forced into POT textures regardless of isForcePOTSize().

Returns:
true if we should ensure POT sized textures, flase if we should attempt to use NPOT if supported

setForcePOT

public static void setForcePOT(boolean b)
Set whether we are forcing loaded image data into power-of-two OpenGL textures (by default, this is true). If non-power-of-two textures is not supported in hardware (i.e. isNPOTSupported returns false), then the image data will be forced into POT textures regardless of isForcePOTSize().

Parameters:
b - true if we should ensure POT sized textures, flase if we should attempt to use NPOT if supported

getTextureCount

public static int getTextureCount()
Returns the current number of active textures. Calling InternalTextureLoader.createTextureID increases this number. Calling TextureImpl.release or InternalTextureLoader.deleteTextureID decreases this number.

Returns:
the number of active OpenGL textures

createTextureID

public static int createTextureID()
Create a new texture ID; will increase the value for getTextureCount.

Returns:
A new texture ID

deleteTextureID

public static void deleteTextureID(int id)
Used internally; call TextureImpl.release.

Parameters:
id - the id of the OpenGL texture

isGenerateMipmapSupported

public static boolean isGenerateMipmapSupported()
Slick uses glGenerateMipmap() or GL14.GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP to automatically build mipmaps (for advanced users). If neither of these versions are supported, the GL_EXT_framebuffer_object is used as a fallback, and if that extension is also missing, this method returns false.

Returns:
whether the version is >= 1.4 or GL_EXT_framebuffer_object extension exists

isNPOTSupported

public static boolean isNPOTSupported()
Returns true if non-power-of-two textures are supported in hardware via the GL_ARB_texture_non_power_of_two extension. Non-power-of-two texture loading is not a current feature of Slick, although it is planned.

Returns:
true if the extension is listed

createTexture

public TextureImpl createTexture(ImageData data,
                                 ByteBuffer buffer,
                                 String ref,
                                 int target,
                                 int minFilter,
                                 int magFilter,
                                 boolean genMipmaps,
                                 ImageData.Format internalFormat)
                          throws IOException
An advanced texture loading method providing more parameters for glTexImage2D. The created texture will not be placed in the cache.

If genMipmaps is true, the loader will attempt to automatically build mipmaps with either GL30.glGenerateMipmap() or GL14.GL_GENERATE_MIPMAP. If the GL version is less than 1.4, then no mipmaps will be built and instead the magFilter (one of GL_LINEAR or GL_NEAREST) will be used for both minification and magnification. Users can determine mipmap generation support with isGenerateMipmapSupported().

If the internalFormat is not null, then that will override the default pixel format described by this InternalTextureLoader (either GL_RGBA16 or GL_RGBA8 depending on the is16BitMode() value). This parameter can be independent of the format of ImageData -- OpenGL will convert the ImageData format (e.g. BGRA) to the given internalFormat (e.g. RGB). Note that internalFormat is more limited than the ImageData's format; i.e. BGRA as an internal storage format is only supported if GL_ext_bgra is present.

After calling this, the texture will be bound and the target (e.g. GL_TEXTURE_2D) will be enabled. If you are using a higher priority target, such as 3D textures, you should disable that afterwards to ensure compatibility with Slick.

The ByteBuffer data is assumed to match getTexWidth/getTexHeight in ImageData.

Parameters:
data - the image data holding width, height, format (ImageData byte buffer is ignored)
buffer - the actual data to send to GL
ref - The name to give the TextureImpl
target - The texture target we're loading this texture into
minFilter - The scaling down filter
magFilter - The scaling up filter
genMipmaps - true to generate mipmaps (failure will fallback to using magFilter)
internalFormat - the internal format of the texture (or null for default)
Returns:
The texture loaded
Throws:
IOException - Indicates a failure to load the image

reload

public int reload(TextureImpl texture,
                  int srcPixelFormat,
                  int componentCount,
                  int minFilter,
                  int magFilter,
                  ByteBuffer textureBuffer)
Reload a given texture blob; used internally with setHoldTextureData. Call TextureImpl.reload instead.

Parameters:
texture - The texture being reloaded
srcPixelFormat - The source pixel format
componentCount - The component count
minFilter - The minification filter
magFilter - The magnification filter
textureBuffer - The pixel data
Returns:
The ID of the newly created texture
